channel.title: Scamming
channel.description:
Right so this morning I was on my new pure. I was walking from draynor bank to lumbridge when this level 30 something in full addy and addy 2h trades with me. I accept and he offers 18k, probably trying to show off how rich he is or something. I offer 5 mill just to show how much better at the game I am than him (Don't flame me I know its not much). I then decline and continue to walk to Lumbridge.
He follows me, continuely trading me. When I finaly reached Lumbridge I got really pissed off so I accepted his trade yet again. He this time just offers his full addy and the 2h. He says "40k please!" I offer 40k then quickly remove 36k and accept. The noob accepts. I then accept the second trading screen. There was a pause for about 5 seconds then, I was expecting him to decline and call me a scammer or something. But after the 5 seconds, he accepts. I then run off giggling at the fool.
I know I didn't scam much, the point of the scam wasn't to make money, but to piss that friggen noob off.
So the question I pose to you is, Is it right to scam?

@WhiteShadow wrote:

Satan embraces all the dirty bitches.

@The_0ne wrote:

Scamming shouldn’t be seen as an achievment to me. I dont agree with removing a whole heap of money and making an unfair trade look virtually TOO FAIR. As Fagex says: if it is too good to be true it often is! lol! but yea I can agree with you if the person is a dam annoying nub…yes lol.

[quote=“ryefox2, post:1, topic:14883”]Right so this morning I was on my new pure. I was walking from draynor bank to lumbridge when this level 30 something in full addy and addy 2h trades with me. I accept and he offers 18k, probably trying to show off how rich he is or something. I offer 5 mill just to show how much better at the game I am than him (Don’t flame me I know its not much). I then decline and continue to walk to Lumbridge.

He follows me, continuely trading me. When I finaly reached Lumbridge I got really pissed off so I accepted his trade yet again. He this time just offers his full addy and the 2h. He says “40k please!” I offer 40k then quickly remove 36k and accept. The noob accepts. I then accept the second trading screen. There was a pause for about 5 seconds then, I was expecting him to decline and call me a scammer or something. But after the 5 seconds, he accepts. I then run off giggling at the fool.

I know I didn’t scam much, the point of the scam wasn’t to make money, but to piss that friggen noob off.

So the question I pose to you is, Is it right to scam?[/quote]

item.title: Scamming
item.dc:creator: @not2good not2good
item.description:
@not2good wrote:

[quote=“irfan786, post:39, topic:14883”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=22181.msg303873#msg303873 date=1160473060]
Scamming for personal gain IN ANY FORM, is wrong. Hell, any scamming is wrong but if it’s justified it’s still wrong but it really changes peoples opinions.

I fallen for a scam because I was up all night, I was tired, dose it mean I deserved to be scammed?
[/quote]
Yes, its only a game, you should have slept.[/quote]
Yes true…Maybe you didn’t deserve to be scammed, but does the scammer know you were half sleep and was trying to take advantage of that? Probably not.

Read full topic
